channel.title: open source on Sauce Labs Open Source
channel.description: Recent content in open source on Sauce Labs Open Source

item.title: (Ͼ˳Ͽ)...check-my-repo!!!
item.description: This is a text about open source, and everything you need to be proud of your repository.

item.title: The new Selenium Grid
item.description: In the fourth and final post in his series, Simon Stewart continues talking about what’s coming in Selenium 4 and reviews what’s new in the Selenium Grid.

item.title: New Tricks in Selenium 4
item.description: In the third post in his series, Simon Stewart continues talking about what’s coming in Selenium 4 and reviews some of the tricks in the new release.

item.title: What’s Coming in Selenium 4: Why The Major Version Bump?
item.description: In the second post in this series, Simon Stewart continues talking about what’s coming in Selenium 4 and why this release has a major version bump.

item.title: What’s Coming in Selenium 4: How Can I Contribute?
item.description: In this new blog series all about the upcoming release of Selenium 4, Simon Stewart will cover how the Selenium project works, who is involved, how you can get involved, and a sneak peek at what’s new in Selenium 4.

item.title: SeleniumConf Virtual 2020 Recap
item.description: This year the Selenium Conference was held virtually, and despite that, the conference was again that exciting place where the Selenium community meets every year to share and learn about the most popular browser automation tool in the world.

item.title: How to delete your master branch
item.description: At the Selenium project we practice trunk based development, in which trunk is the usual name of the default git branch of the repository.

item.title: How Open Source Can Drive Product Obsession
item.description: Nearly every start-up company goes through the same experience - the founders will start with a vision or idea that pivots over time as the product (hopefully) finds its market fit and is modified and adapted to the needs and requests of end users.
